segment.source: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Configure the App-V Client Registry Settings by Using the Command Line

segment.source: After the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client has been deployed and configured during the installation by using the command line, it might be necessary to change one or more client configuration settings.
segment.target: After the Application Virtualization (App-V) Client has been deployed and configured during the installation by using the command line, it might be necessary to change one or more client configuration settings.

segment.source: This is accomplished by editing the appropriate registry keys, using one of the following methods:
segment.target: This is accomplished by editing the appropriate registry keys, using one of the following methods:

segment.source: Using the Registry Editor directly
segment.target: Using the Registry Editor directly

segment.source: Using a .reg file
segment.target: Using a .reg file

segment.source: Using a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Using a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell

segment.source: There is also an ADM template that you can use.
segment.target: There is also an ADM template that you can use.

segment.source: For more information about the ADM template, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835.
segment.target: For more information about the ADM template, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: Use care when you edit the registry because errors can leave the computer in an unusable state.
segment.target: Use care when you edit the registry because errors can leave the computer in an unusable state.

segment.source: Be sure to follow your standard business practices that relate to registry edits.
segment.target: Be sure to follow your standard business practices that relate to registry edits.

segment.source: Thoroughly test all proposed changes in a test environment before you deploy them to production computers.
segment.target: Thoroughly test all proposed changes in a test environment before you deploy them to production computers.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: On a 64-bit computer, the keys and values described in the following sections will be under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5Client.
segment.target: On a 64-bit computer, the keys and values described in the following sections will be under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5Client.

segment.source: How to Reset the FileSystem Cache
segment.target: How to Reset the FileSystem Cache

segment.source: Provides the information that is required to reset the FileSystem cache.
segment.target: Provides the information that is required to reset the FileSystem cache.

segment.source: How to Change the Size of the FileSystem Cache
segment.target: How to Change the Size of the FileSystem Cache

segment.source: Explains how you can change the size of the cache.
segment.target: Explains how you can change the size of the cache.

segment.source: How to Use the Cache Space Management Feature
segment.target: How to Use the Cache Space Management Feature

segment.source: Describes how you can configure the cache space management feature.
segment.target: Describes how you can configure the cache space management feature.

segment.source: How to Configure the Client Log File
segment.target: How to Configure the Client Log File

segment.source: Describes the various registry key values that control the client log file and how you can change them.
segment.target: Describes the various registry key values that control the client log file and how you can change them.

segment.source: How to Configure User Permissions
segment.target: How to Configure User Permissions

segment.source: Identifies the registry key that controls the user permissions and gives examples of how you can change some permissions.
segment.target: Identifies the registry key that controls the user permissions and gives examples of how you can change some permissions.

segment.source: How to Configure the Client for Application Package Retrieval
segment.target: How to Configure the Client for Application Package Retrieval

segment.source: Explains how to configure the client to retrieve package content, icons, and file type associations from different sources, and provides several examples of the correct path format.
segment.target: Explains how to configure the client to retrieve package content, icons, and file type associations from different sources, and provides several examples of the correct path format.

segment.source: How to Configure the Client for Disconnected Operation Mode
segment.target: How to Configure the Client for Disconnected Operation Mode

segment.source: Provides information about how to configure the various settings associated with disconnected operations mode.
segment.target: Provides information about how to configure the various settings associated with disconnected operations mode.

segment.source: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior
segment.target: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior

segment.source: Describes the registry key values that control shortcuts and file type associations in the App-V client, and provides details on how to configure them.
segment.target: Describes the registry key values that control shortcuts and file type associations in the App-V client, and provides details on how to configure them.
